text: You know when your looking for wholesome food.. like warm hit the spot food. This is the place. Anytime I come here I leave feeling satisfied. I see people have mixed reviews here BUT it's not the restaurants fault if you order the wrong thing. I love cheese but not blue cheese so I won't order something with blue cheese, it's that simple!! They have many things on the menu so you need to know what you love. The gnocchi is to die for, its fresh and made perfectly. Also get the goat cheese appetizer it's warm and so satisfying. If you love pasta you will love this place!

Tommy was our waiter and did a fantastic job managing the busy restaurant, while providing fast and friendly service. I had the ravioli with spinach and cheese in a spicy vodka sauce, it was delicious. My other half got a salad with the tomato dill soup. The soup especially was amazing. It's a great little boost to to already very tasty tomato soup.

OK this has already been my fallback place for a decent, well prepared, good tasting Italian meal. And they still don't disappoint.It can be a little tight on seating, as it is a intimate place with a dozen tables. I can say that they have been consistent in their food preparation for ten years, which is hard to say for almost any place. Go there, get a window seat, enjoy the food, and watch the world walking by on Halsted

Dropped in with a friend for dinner. I was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is nothing special and is on the casual side but the food is so good! It's the perfect portions to eat just enough and not walk away feeling stuffed. Also, so affordable! It's definitely a great family spot.

Great neighborhood spot. They have so much variety, the food is consistently good, it's a great value and it lacks any and all pretension. We just moved to LP and it's already feeling like it'll be an old faithful. Highly reco the jalapeno gnocchi - lil clouds with a kick :)

This is usually a great go to for my husband and I. Love the jalapeño gnocchi! Sadly, I couldn't be more disappointed with their rude service. On Tuesday night, my husband and I were going there for dinner and arrived around 7:30. There was a 20-25 minute wait. The hostess was short and not very friendly. We asked her if we could order a glass of wine while we waited for our table. She practically threw the drink menu at us and walked away (never returning). Then we asked if we could sit at the bar (as it's usually first come first serve) and her response was there's only one chair. When we found two chairs together she scolded us like children, with aggressive arm gestures, saying there was a wait and we can't just sit wherever we want. At this point we had enough of her rudeness and left the restaurant. Sadly not sure if we will return.
I had a dinner on Tuesday night! Reviews were awesome so I have called before coming in to know if there is open tables. I got my table pretty quick. Service awesome!

Really good Italian at an incredibly affordable price. I'm a fan. The jalapeño gnocchi was delicious, as were the meatballs. Goat cheese appetizer was also solid. The only thing I didn't like was the Caesar salad. That was surprisingly unimpressive, especially given how delicious everything else was. The other salads at nearby tables looked good, though, so I'll try a different one next time. I'll definitely be back.

This is my favorite pasta place in Chicago, which is saying a lot because there are a ton in Chicago! The pasta is so tasty; and everything is fresh and authentic! They make the pasta in front of you (the kitchen is right behind the bar seating) so you know everything they are using is fresh. Highly recommend! Super cute mom and pop place.

This is my new go-to for pasta. We went in for a dinner and the aroma coming from the kitchen was heavenly! Their pasta menu is versatile and comforting at the same time. They offer a good variety of sides and the pasta can be customized to your liking. We tried the baked goats cheese with marinara as appetizer along with the jalapeño gnocchi. Gnocchi was delicious and packed full of flavor. The marinara was a tad bit on the bland side but went well with the baked goats cheese and bread. What made our day was the prompt service and genuinely nice people managing this restaurant. It's a trendy, casual place which is easy on the pocket while serving good food.

I had a lovely dinner here with some girlfriends before a concert at Lincoln hall. From the rustic crusty bread to the cooked to order pasta dishes, everything was tasty. We tried the house made tortellinis in marinara sauce. The tortellinis were wonderful. However, I found the marinara too sweet and on the bland side. We also had the pasta fungi. It's a marsala cream sauce with mixed mushrooms. It was just lovely. I've never had a creamy Marsala sauce before--truly unique and outstanding. Finally we tried the house made (specialty) jalapeño gnocchi. These were the highlight of the meal, for sure. The best pasta dish I have ever had the pleasure of eating. I haven't stopped thinking about it since! I described them as little pillows of creamy spicy heaven. You must must try this dish! I'm excited to go back sometime soon, thanks Pasta Palazzo!
Great meals with so much flavor! Both meals we ordered were perfectly sized for a dinner and left us stuffed.  Simple, fresh ingredients with a nice atmosphere = the way Italian should be enjoyed!

My daughter was looking for Italian food for birthday and we read reviews and decided to go here. Glad we did. 5 people, 4 different meals, all were excellent. Fresh with great flavors. Cozy place with good service. Definitely going back as prices are very low for the quality.
Always very good.  We get take out and also eat there too.  Grilled asparagus and a healthy version pasta are the usual items ordered.  Reasonably priced too.
Hand made pasta was fantastic. Mozzarella was fresh. Gnocchi is melt in your mouth good! Dined on a Tuesday evening and it was steady busy. Service was quick and polite.

My wife and I both agreed it was some of the best pasta we have ever had.  The menu looked a little simple at first compared to restaurants with pages and pages of options, but I rather liked focusing on things they do well - and they did it really well. :)

This place is great if you're looking to grab a meal without the fuss. I ordered the Grilled Asparagus with lemon-herb vinaigrette as an appetizer and the Penne with Chicken and Sundried Tomato Cream sauce - so amazing! Seriously blown away by how delicious all the food tasted. My boyfriend, who is usually a critic, was even complimenting our meal. I think patrons will especially appreciate being able to see the food being made in front of them. Will absolutely be going back, two thumbs up. I'm giving them 4 stars only because the restaurant was a little small.
Absolutely amazing food! Pasta is fantastic and owner is very pleasent and accommodating. I got the jalapeño gnocchi and it was phenomenal. Highly recommend!
Dined in.  Fettuccine special and homemade tortellini orders were delicious. Service also very quick, which is great.  Free bread‼‼
Average. No great but not terrible either. Ordered delivery. Pasta was over cooked. Frutti Del Mar was a little light on the seafood. The highlight was the meatballs.

Delightful neighborhood place. Friendly greeting upon arrival and prompt service.  I had the grilled portobello with pesto. WONDERFUL.  My husband had the meatball sandwich and said great flavor. A little too much bread but was easy to remedy.
Been eating here and getting takeout for 10 years.  Great people, easy-going, consistency with the great food!  Very reasonable $ as well.

This place is always busy during dinner time, so I took my date to this place at opening for lunch and had no issue getting a table... in fact we had freedom to choose where we wanted to sit. This place is very cozy even though it's small inside and you definitely get a hipster or contemporary feel rather than "authentic italian". I really liked how you could see your dish being prepared since the stove for preparing dishes was behind the counter. The bread here was nothing special, but I really enjoyed the grilled calamari because of the simplicity in preparation and the fact it was properly cooked.  It was not rubbery whatsoever and the char marks added great complexity of flavor. My main dish was the jalapeno gnocchi with sausage.  The spice wasn't overwhelming and I'd say it was more of a small kick, which was great because the heat didn't take away from the flavors.  The gnocchi is homemade too, which made it taste even better.  The texture and taste from the dish overall was extremely good and I can see why so many people recommend this dish.  I highly recommend getting the sausage because the added fat and flavor of the meat really tie things together. I'll obviously come here again... whether casually or for another date!

A hidden go-to spot in LP.  The Atkins movement has put a damper on pasta generally speaking, but Palaz is well worth it.  I've gone through most of the menu at this point, and would have to call out the pesto and Cavatapi Pollo as the top two. You really can't go wrong with any other option, thought. The bread / olive oil are money, too.  Staff is friendly, and if you're apartment's heat stops working for whatever reason, come here for the warmest eating experience in the city (I mean it in an endearing way, not complaining).

My Favorite restaurant in the city of Chicago. Its a cozy, casual neighborhood joint that has the best made to order pasta you will find in the city. No need to go out for a fancy Italian dinner, when you can go here. I almost refuse to go out for Italian as I know I can spend 1/3 of the amount and have a better dish then here! Take out typically takes a quick 15 - 20 minutes. The best of Lincoln Park for sure!!

A good casual pasta spot. Un-pretentious, good service and easy on the pocket. It's a departure from the usual quiet, Italian restaurants. The ambience is approachable, targeted toward younger everyday, clientele. Hence the food is not as expensive. Would dine here frequently if I lived closer.

Carb lovers paradise. I don't think I've ever had a harder time deciding what pasta I wanted. Penne, linguine, spaghetti, farfalle, capellini. You name it, they've got it. Plenty to make vegetarians and meat lovers happy.  It's a tiny space so it can get a little crowded and there may be a wait depending on the night. But suck it up, be patient, and wreck your body with some delicious pasta!

Hands down the best italian food I have had. Went there twice in 2 weeks cz we couldn't stop thinking about our first experience there.  We have only tried their homemade pasta (jalapeno gnocchi, ravioli with pesto and tortellini with gorganzola cream). The sauces are really flavorful and the jalapeno gnocchi def has a good kick.  If you choose to sit at the bar you get to see the chefs cooking which is very entertaining.  The restaurant itself is fairly small so do expect a wait but the service is great.

I have been a cocktail server for many years but I never experienced such a rude attitude from a server. I went there with my roommate for dinner. We didn't know that they were closing in 10 minutes. The server with glasses came to the table and asked for our order. I asked for the alcohol menu. The server left kind off upset, then he came back and threw the alcohol menu at the table making a loud sound, he didn't even made eye contact or apologized. Then he came back and said, we are closing in 5 minutes. We decided to leave because it was obvious that we were not welcome. I left in shock and upset due to the rudeness and lack of tact of the server. I was there on 03/22/17.  To the server, you are not made for this job. You need to learn basic manners and have tact when you treat people. I am a server as well, at the end of the night the only thing that I want to do is go home. But because you want to go home, you don't have the right to treat people like trash. You are not dealing with your parents, siblings or friends you are at work, be professional. You work for the tips but you really don't care, it is just a job for you. Disgusting!

Hands down my favorite pasta place in the city. The restaurant itself is cozy but the service is great and food is always amazing. You honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu - Cavatappi Pollo & Gnocchi are two of my faves.

The atmosphere definitely made the experience great. We sat at the bar and watching the cooks cook right in front of us! The food was also great. I had the meatball sandwich. Would definitely recommend to everyone!!!

My mom and I had originally been planning to go to another restaurant around the corner, but that place didn't have seating so we decided to search for another place. Pasta Palazzo was close by and we saw its' positive ratings on Yelp so we decided it was perfect!  My mom and I ordered the goat cheese appetizer, small salads (caesar for me, mixed greens for my mom) and we split the penne con salsiccie. I don't really like goat cheese, but I loved the appetizer. It was kind of like bread with marinera sauce and some cheese. I really enjoyed it. The salads were good but not out of this world. I mean, it takes a lot for some lettuce to be crazy unique. The pasta dish was very good! We finished every last bit of it. The sausage had an amazing flavor and the mushroom in the dish made for a bit of a twist in the dish. My mom and I really enjoyed our experience and said we would probably be back!

We stubbled upon this delicious restaurant while shopping. It was delicious. The goat cheese with fresh basil sauce appetizer was the best! Would go there for that alone. Super service and pretty interior.

This place was cute and had a great atmosphere. The decor was nice and visually pleasing. The wait staff was attentive and efficient. The food was good and we enjoyed a nice dinner here.  I had the vegetarian salad and tomato soup. Both were tasty. The veggies on the salad were warm and the balsamic dressing was whipped. The waiter said the tomato soup was a favorite by many which is why it's always available. I enjoyed. Definitely recommend.

I happened to find this place on Yelp and let me tell you it lived up to it's hype. It i not a fancy place but still is very comfortable. We started out with the Bruschetta and it was very good. My wife had Penne Alle Melanzane and she loved it. I had the Spaghetti Frutti di Mare which was fantastic. I had one glass of wine. Our bill without tip was 35.00 The service was great. No doubt we'll be coming back here on a regular basis.
Now they serving alcohol too, but BYOB option is still on a table for a corkage fee. My favorite thing about this place is food, haha!  Friendly stuff, cosy atmosphere.

Had just an ok experience here.  I was really looking forward to trying the pasta again, I have been to this restaurant a few times since living in the city and always enjoyed my meal.   I opted for the healthy primavera and asked if I could have it with a different sauce.  I prefer something lighter and usually enjoy my pasta with an olive oil& garlic sauce.  I asked our server if that was possible and she said "we could do that for you." My meal came and I took a few bites only the find out I was given plain noodles with olive oil just sprinkled on top.  It was for the most part plain and dry.  Trying to make my situation better and thinking nothing of it, I asked the server if I could have a cup of red sauce on the side to add to my meal, since the initial sauce was not what I was told it would be.  The server then came back and told me I would be $5 for a cup on the side..... Seriously?!?! A $9 pasta which had virtually no type of sauce in the first place was then going to cost me $5 for a few spoonfuls of sauce?  I could buy a whole jar for less than that.   This really ruined my experience and I find it to be petty.  I don't know if this is the protocol or typical or if the server was mistaken.  I probably will not be back.  This is so unfortunate I had high hopes for my meal!

Amazing food, and very nice service! Only reason why it don't get 5 stars it's the noice level. We were there on a Saturday at 7pm, and the place was packed. It's truly a very popular place and the noice is just a result of that. But once again, food, price and service was awesome! We'll be back again for sure!

I was really excited for a delicious and affordable Italian place within a moment's notice, and upon finding out about Pasta Palazzo and perusing the menu I had really high expectations. Going in ordered a small Caesar salad(deluding myself into being 'healthy') along with the jalapeno gnocchi, which seemed like a fan favorite. Very polarized. The Caesar salad just had so much dressing when I got it, it was hard to finish. As in, I didn't finish it. That aside, the jalapeno gnocchi was delicious. Incredibly fluffy pieces of home-made gnocchi tossed in a deliciously savory red pepper sauce that I'd like to pour on all my pastas. They're filled with a bit of ricotta too, so when you bite into these pillows you get fluffy inside fluffy. The portion size isn't that large for what you're paying($11), but the quality was arguably worth it. Will avoid the salad next time, and check out their other pasta options to see how they compare on the flavor/cost scale.

Fantastic service, big servings, and the best tasting pasta dishes at such an affordable price. Keep in mind that the place is small, gets a little too loud, and might get more crowded during dinner time.

Visited Pasta Palazzo with a group of four on a Saturday night around 6:30. We were seated after a brief 5 minute wait. The restaurant is fairly small with the kitchen in the dining area, so some tables have a good view of their food being prepared. Everyone in our party agreed that the food was just okay and the menu options pretty bland, things we could have fairly easily made at home ourselves. That said, they came at a value, priced at $10-12 a plate. My biggest complaint was that most of the dishes were vegetarian, but some people are into that, I guess.  I ordered one of the specials, the seafood risotto with broccoli. It came with some shrimp and scallops, but wasn't anything to write home about. The best dish I sampled was the jalapeño gnocchi, which was stuffed with ricotta. It had very little spice, just enough to taste it but no more. It would have been amazing if we had added sausage to it. Not sure if they allow that. We also ordered garlic bread and bruschetta as appetizers. They were also good, but not great. Had I known we were going to get free bread with our meals, I probably would have skipped those.

A very casual spot. I think they need more space. It's very small with an open kitchen and half the seating is at the bar overlooking it. Wish we could make reservations or order delivery or have a digital way to get on the list to wait. Super tight waiting area and they just take your name. We had some yummy pasta and apps - would go back for some casual pasta!

The pasta here is awesome. My go to is the healthy chicken. The location is great and I dig the vibe inside. Stop in if you're looking to mix it up and have a taste for Italian. They also have really good sausage.

My friends have always raved about this place, I went for lunch and absolutely loved it. We got bruschetta for a starter, it was very fresh with crunchy bread, not soggy. Then a Caesar salad to split with the pasta pollo and cream sauce. I am still in college and constantly looking for good food with a low price, this place fit that description well.

I have been going to Pasta Palazzo for years now..My sister Pam exposed me to this Lincoln Park treasure and I have been hooked since! This review is long over due!!  Their meals are CONSISTENT, FAST, & WARM. The staff is also pleasant and accommodating..I seriously rave about this place to anyone looking for a quick, GOOD, AUTHENTIC, bite in Lincoln Park.  Everything is just so good!!! The meals are super affordable as well and the atmosphere is cozy ..I couldn't ask for a better pasta joint..The goat cheese, alfredo, & the chicken sandwich is my favorite.  Everyone I bring here, leaves FULL & HAPPY! Thank you for bringing such a fantastic place to Lincoln Park!!

As disappointing as this sounds, but an expectation of delicious Italian food doesn't get quite satisfied by coming here. They have a great selection of various dishes and drinks that they serve, along with some specials they have of the day...though some staple Italian food dishes were missing from the menus. (Pasta Carbonara, just to name one...) Delicious bread and olive oil though before your meal comes to the table, and an interesting atmosphere to say the least. I wouldn't say that I will never come back here again, but if choosing between here and dare I say Olive Garden (which I know isn't truly Italian), I would choose Olive Garden.

The food is delicious! Plus - substitute gluten free penne in any dish for an additional $2 I stopped in here for lunch and was able to quickly grab a table. Within about 10 minutes, the restaurant was full, so I guess we dropped in at the perfect moment.  The staff was friendly from the second we walked in the door and remained attentive even once all the tables were filled.  I went with a daily special - Seafood Risotto. Risotto with shrimp, calamari, scallops and broccoli in a tomato cream sauce. It was beyond delicious. The creamy tomato sauce was the perfect overlay of the seafood mix. The broccoli added a nice, fresh crunch.  The serving size was more than enough for me! I took it home and had lunch the following day!

Came here last night with a group of girlfriends for dinner. We waited about 20 minutes for a table to open up. When we sat down we were greeted by the waiter and were asked if we want something to drink. We all got a glass of wine, I had the house red and it was a great combo of sweet and dry. I needed a few minute to decide what I wanted so in the mean time they brought out bread for the table (YUM). Three of the girls ordered the Jalapeno gnocchi (clearly a house fave), another girl ordered the house healthy special, and I still needed assistance and was recommended to order the Cavatappi Pollo. I enjoyed my decision but added probably half a bottle of red pepper flakes (I really like the heat).  Cute, rustic and homey atmosphere. I definitely recommend this restaurant to pasta lovers.

I have been frequenting Pasta Palazzo for a long time now, and have NEVER been disappointed. The menu is delightful and the specials are just a little slice of surprise. I always enjoy the staff who are bright, knowledgeable, and energetic, oh and super cool. Yesterday, my son and I went in for an early dinner, and as usual Pasta Palazzo did not fail. Piping hot comfort food on a cold and rainy day is always a great combination.

My favorite thing about this place is how consistent they are. I've been too many times to count being that I'm a DePaul alumni who used to live near it and I can truthfully say every time it was spot on. Some favorites of mine are the regular and jalapeno gnocchi, both equally delicious. Aside from the food which is pretty spot on the service can be hit or miss. Typically you'll get a friendly server but it may take a while for them to get to you. It's a pretty small place so typically they have one or two people taking care of everyone which can be a lot to handle, so just be patient. Food and service aside, the atmosphere is pretty amazing! The restaurant has a pretty vibrant color scheme and it truly feels like a warm and cozy setting. They also typically have some good tunes on as well. The size of the restuarant can cause it to get pretty loud during a busy dinner service but that's something you really can't control. Price-wise, this place offers great value. A super filling pasta dish will run you about 10 bucks which is pretty rare for good Italian and especially good considering its location on the wonderfully pretentious Armitage street.  Perfect for date nights or family gatherings, you should give this place a shot. Especially if you're a semi broke DePaul student trying to impress a date haha.

This is my favorite date night restaurant in Chicago. Seriously. Been going here with my girlfriend for 4+ years now. Exceptional food, great service, amazing sangria, what else could you ask for? The staff is friendly but beware they don't take reservations (which I kind of like). Go here any night of the week and check out the specials written on the chalk board. I guarantee you won't be disappointed! You can also carry out. Highly suggest the cavatappi pollo, bruschetta, sangria, and anything with the spicy vodka sauce or on the "specials" chalk board.
This place is awesome! Consistently excellent service and food, and fairly affordable (particularly for its location).

Pretty good taste, but somewhat overpriced for its portions. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with a side salad for $10. The bun was fresh and soft and most importantly...the meat. The chicken was honestly so good. They cook it on the grill which gives it a nice charcoal flavor. On top of that, they put grilled red peppers and a really tasty secret sauce that explodes in my mouth.

Wow... Jalapeño gnocchi with scallops... No joke. And the fungi with sausage?? Fantastic. My husband and I were pleasantly surprised! The setting is crowded. But totally worth it and loved the staff :) Ambiance is definitely casual. Everything is also affordable. LOVE! Fourth time here... still love it!! Tried the veal tortellacci this time

Selected Pasta Palazzo on a whim while walking down Halsted. Everyone commented their food was delicious. We'll be back!  Love the ability to add vegetables and meats to your pasta and the ability to select your sauce. Definitely worth checking out.

We don't use 'awesome' to describe restaurants as much, unless they are superb. However, AWESOME is solely the word to say about Pasta Palazzo. Whether you're craving for authentic Italian food or just a rich meal, this place should be sitting at number One on your list. The food is five star for a very affordable price. The restaurant has special menu for everyday and some are worth trying. We tried plenty, and Jalapeño gnocchi is one must-try dish - it just WOW! Gnocchi is as soft as pillows and just melt in your mouth. The portion isn't crazily big, but rest assured that you're getting what you pay for because each bite is a piece of heaven itself. And yes, the food is great and you can make it even better as you like it by tweaking the food in any way you want. They have always been very accommodating with customer's special order. If you drop by at dinner, make sure to order some cocktail to go along with your superb meal. Bread are provided free of charge but nothing is spectacular about it, just the typical chewy white bread. Recommended : Caesar salad with Shrimp, Jalapeño gnocchi, Lobster-stuff Ravioli in Alfredo cream sauce For more, visit us at:  thecoupleeats.com/5-must…

I had high hopes for this place, but the food didn't live up to my expectations. Nothing that my boyfriend and I ordered was necessarily bad, but nothing was really tasty either. The best thing that we tried was the grilled calamari appetizer. However, the bread that was served as an appetizer tasted a little bit stale. I ordered the veggie primavera pasta and my boyfriend ordered the penne con salsiccie pasta. Both of us were a little bit underwhelmed with these dishes- they lacked a lot of flavor. I wouldn't be upset if I ended up going back to Pasta Palazzo for some reason, but I definitely wouldn't choose to go back.

Great place for pasta! My friend and I ordered the risotto special and the penne funghi to split. Both dishes were very good! They had the right amount of sauce on them. The prices were pretty good too! i wish the menu had more creative options on it as opposed to some slight variation of some dishes.
Amazing pasta. Cooked fresh right in front of you.  Adorable little place. Wish it was closer to where I lived, I'd be here every week.
It's fine ... quick service you can BYOB but they will now charge a corkage fee ($10 per bottle).  Portion size match the prices.  Server was quick to keep us moving towards the check.

Everything was awesome. Service, food, décor. I'd only suggest, since I'm willing to 'pay up' for the add ons to the homemade pastas, they'd be a bit more substantial (in quality, at the least) Otherwise I loved it!

Just left this place and had to leave a 5 star review. The menu was really reasonably priced with a great selection. The food itself was presented really well and faultless  in taste. The house wine was also delicious. All of this served by a really lovely lady. You just can't go wrong here- especially for the price. We'll be back!

I've dined in twice and both have been great visits!  Super casual that's fun to dine in or have carryout (note: I've only dined in. However, I saw a TON of carryout orders). On my most recent visit, we sat at the bar, which gives you a front row view of the small kitchen. It was fun to sit there because you get to see all the types of pastas/sauces they make in front of you (plus, the warmth of the grill is nice!) They have a small wine list that's accessible and inexpensive. Bring a friend and split a bottle :) The food has always been great. I've had the much-discussed jalapeno gnocchi, penne bolognese, and a pesto dish. I've also had the garlic bread. Every item was perfectly sized (if not too large), piping hot, and tasted wonderful. Also, with price points from $8-$12, it won't break the bank! While I will still go to Topo Gigio for our nice dinner dates, PP is an awesome choice for a fun, casual night out. Highly recommend!

I had a family get together at my house last night and ordered Pasta Palazzo for dinner.  Everyone loved the food.  We had the pollo dish, Jalepeno gnoohi and the cucumber salad.  I wasn't sure how much to order and the lady on the phone was very helpful.  I have eaten at the restaurant before and the place is really cute and the the food is delicious especially at this price point.  To add, the service is always outstanding.  I really recommend this place.

We got the ravioli with spicy vodka sauce, mushroom with toast, asparagus, and Cesar salad. So delicious! They have a great menu for great prices. Freshly made food, nice waiters, and a great deal! Been twice and definitely going back!

Second time here and it is a really solid Italian place. The homemade gnocchi is delicious.   Can get busy in the evening. They do not take reservations but worth the wait.  Small space but very tasty
We didn't have a place in mind to eat in Lincoln Park,  but certainly glad we saw this place and stopped. Delicious pasta, nice casual service. Bruschetta had wonderful flavor. Can't wait to go back!
Ivhad beed craving a place like this for so long. You can see how everything is cooked.

This place is delicious! I went here on a whim and was impressed by how good the food was. I ordered the bruschetta and chicken Alfredo. The prices are also very good and the portions are big too. I would recommend this place to anyone who is wanting Italian food.

I've been here plenty of times and plan on coming again and again.  Each dish is made individually in its own pan, it's fresh, delicious, and the portion is huge.  The appetizers are equally delicious.  The grilled portabella mushroom is a must have.  The place is small so you may have to wait for a table.  The wait is well worth it.  Being a small place can also cause it to get hot inside but I don't mind.

Solid Italian spot that actually isn't very expensive despite the area, I got mussels in tomato sauce for only $8, though I think that it was definitely more of an appetizer instead of an entree, those went for usually $9-$11. Even though what I got wasn't that big, it was still good, and the pasta my friend got looked very good, so next time I come back I will definitely get a pasta dish
First visit wasn't bad. Pasta was good! Garlic bread need some work! Tasted as if it was something I could've made at home. Garlic bread didn't have enough flavor.

I have been to this place a few times, but have never written a review. First, I love their $6 sangria. I had this both times, and always found it very refreshing. My first visit the place was empty and I had the jalapeño gnocchi. Service was quick and I was almost licking the plate afterwards it was so good. The second time I was here the place was packed, so it was no big deal service was a bit slower. I ordered Mac and cheese (lame, but I love it so much ) and I was not impressed at all. I know I wasn't trying anything but special, but I think pasta places should have good Mac and cheese.

Great find as we were just walking along Halstead. Best jalapeño gnocchi in a red pepper purée I've ever had - like little pillow puffs of deliciousness. Great service and cool vibe of this neighborhood treasure.
Delicious food! Outstanding service! I wish I lived or worked closer to Pasta Palazzo!

Really enjoy this place. I've been here twice and think it's a great option for a casual but delicious meal. Very economical as well, most dishes are around $10 so it doesn't even break the bank. Can't wait to return soon!

I have no idea why people say anything bad about this place because I have been here more than 30 times (probably more!) and have never had anything bad to say!!! My favorite is the Cavatappi pollo and the grilled asparagus. The people are always so friendly and kind and the food comes out so quick. Thank you, Pasta Palazzo!

Food is some of the best we have every had.  Super kid friendly.  I love the boosters they use.  Place is really clean.  If we had to choose a place to bring someone out of town, this would be the place.  Our kids love the mac and cheese, so do we!
We go to Pasta Palazzo about once a month because the food is always fresh and well prepared.  it's a very laid back place to have a meal and we are always treated really well there!

This place is awesome! The food and service was great! We ordered the pasta dish that had mushrooms and a pasta dish with sun dried tomatoes and chicken. Both dishes were delicious. For the price and quality, you can't beat if! Can't wait to come back here!

Terrible Customer and Food Service & too Pricey for the Amount they Serve...!!!!!!!! First time visit and my carryout food was never done correctly the first time. After a few hours later I came home to find out that my food was not freshly prepared the second time instead was put aside and later warmed up before pick up.  Whoever owns this place needs to hire a new staff which pays close attention to what the customer wants in person & over the phone. A staff that it is not inconsiderate nor rude but rather understanding, polite,  and apologetic to show common courtesy. First time visit required two visits and four phone calls not including the demand ( by a rude  and complete inconsiderate manager named Christin/a) to see the owner the next day for a refund.

This is a lovely restaurant that specializes in pasta. I have dined here often in the 15 plus years that I have lived in Lakeview-Lincoln Park area and I have never had a disappointing experience. The pastas are all cooked to order and are delicious. Service has always been friendly and efficient. Additionally the ambiance is casual, yet a little upscale. The pricing is extremely easy on the wallet, especially when considering the quality of the food. The pasta portions are not huge, but enough, however the side Caesar and House Salad are generous for $4. You really cannot go wrong here as this is my favorite spot to indulge in a plate of pasta.

There is nothing wrong with Pasta Palazzo, but there is nothing necessarily spectacular about it either. The service was relatively slow, but the food was fine. After all, it is pretty hard to mess up pasta! This menu had a good selection of pasta dishes, and the asparagus appetizer was great!
Service was unfriendly and the sandwich I had was bland. Bread tasted like paper mache, pesto mayo had more mayo than anything.
I embarrassed myself here with how much I ate! I ate my whole bowl of pasta and then half my coworkers and then dug into my bosses Mac n cheese. Couldn't stop myself it was all SO good! Get here now!

This is our nearby pasta place. 5 of us came to eat and arrived at the restaurant around 8:20pm last Sunday 5/8. The tables were about 75% full with people eating. The gentleman host told is "we close at 8:30". We looked around and asked if it was "still ok to sit". He kept saying "well...we close at 8:30". So we gathered that meant no - without him actually having to say no. In my mind, it's either your open and seating guests or not. The passive and uninviting approach by this gentleman was to say the least- disappointing.  Hungry he walked next door to Stella Barra. They were happy to seat us and we had a fantastic meal! Hoping the Owner reads this and makes a change to how this situation is dealt with in the future.

When you are still thinking about the pasta the next day, you know you've got a winner. We went here for dinner this past weekend, and split the Jalapeño Gnocchi and the Veal Tortellacci special. Both were very good, but especially the Tortellacci...I used a piece of bread to get every bit of the creamy sauce of that dish! And for lovers of dishes with a bit of spice, the Jalapeño Gnocchi is stuffed with a delicious blend of Jalapeño pepper and cheese...I don't know why more Italian restaurants don't use Jalapeños! We went for a very early dinner on our way to an event, so it wasn't very crowded...but the space is a tad small, so I can see it getting crowded on busy nights. But, prices are reasonable and service was good, so I think it would be worth a bit of a wait. Enjoy!

This is a great little place!  The food is tasty and the servers are always friendly and attentive. I've had lots on the menu, and I recommend it all.  I also like that they let me do a bit of a "create your own" with my pasta and sauces. It's definitely worth a visit...or two...or ten. :D

Bad experience with service. Otherwise 4 stars for food. Our server seemed to be in his own world. He didn't greet my SO and I (by introducing himself, getting us settled in, etc.) He took our order and didn't return until later in the meal when he gave us the bill (didn't come by to check how we liked the dishes, didn't offer to refill water cups even though mine was empty.) He was passing by and we asked for the check -- no acknowledgment that he had heard us and then brought our check over a few minutes late. He didn't bother to try to remove any of the finished plates on our table until after he brought the check over for a signature. Overall, the sense we got was that we were somehow a burden for him even though we were providing business.  Not likely to return.
Great alternative for the crowded, long wait, neighbor restaurants. Walked right in w/ 4 adults and got served right away. Food was great.

Grilled calamari is pretty darn good.  Farfalle pomodorro formaggio is what I ordered and it was sooooo good.  it's a cute little pasta joint similar to Pasta bowl.  great fresh food with good flavor.  Great prices, easy date night.  Friendly service, nice neighborhood.  Customization is easy.  highly recommend!

Nice place, fast, really friendly service in a relaxed atmosphere. This is a neighborhood place, and if I still lived in the area I'd be here on a regular basis. I'm glad a friend of mine who does suggested it over another place not to far away, she knows I like casual spots, but I don't want fast food either, a place that the quality is there. This place is like the Cheer's of pasta. Good menu of different pasta's and sauces, I wanted a different pasta and sauce combo then what was on the menu, and it was no problem for them to do since everything is made up fresh, and they're friendly flexible folks. I have run across places that simply refuse to put a sauce on a different noodle on the menu, even if they're making it up fresh, I've asked if were pricing, and said just charge me for the more expensive one, and heard back, no can do. Not here, here it was no problem at all. Since I was having Alfredo sauce I decided to have a salad, after all something healthy and green is needed. I ordered the small greens expecting a tiny salad, the salad was a generous size and delicious, I can see just coming here for a salad, bread and a glass of wine. Pricing is insanely reasonable, they get that they're serving up pasta and it isn't topped with caviar.  I'll be planning a return visit soon.

This was our third visit to Pasta Palazzo and worth the cab ride from our downtown hotel. This restaurant is so cozy, inviting, and delicious. The staff is super friendly and efficient (this place is small and very busy!) The food is fresh, reasonably priced, and "made with love" as all the best food is! I recommend the healthy Primavera and a glass of red wine.

We are so lucky to have stumbled into Pasta Palazzo! We were treated to a delicious, affordable Italian meal in a small, cool and modern space.  We sat at the bar and started with a tasty grilled asparagus appetizer ($4!?). The real treat was the red pepper-stuffed gnocchi in Gorgonzola cream sauce ($13). Oh Damn!! It's been visiting me in my dreams ever since. The gnocchi was perfectly soft with a tasty sweet filling in a dope Gorgonzola sauce.   I honestly can't believe the prices at this gem of a restaurant. I love a restaurant that can serve food of this quality in a casual atmosphere that embraces beer by the bottle and stemless wine glasses.  This is exactly what cool casual Italian food should be, and I'm coming back every time I get the chance.

Cheap, good pasta. We went on a fairly busy night so we had to sit in the back directly next to the bathrooms which unfortunately did have a slight smell. However, our waitress was great and our food arrived quickly after ordering. Definitely a nice neighborhood pasta place for an affordable dinner.
Love love love the Gorgonzola dish and I add chicken. Always busy and always delicious.  Only negative is I don't enjoy their bread.  A place with great food most have great bread!

Pasta Palazzo is a very charming Italian restaurant in the heart of Lincoln Park on Halsted. There is not much seating, so call ahead, and be aware they will not seat incomplete parties. If you have a party larger than 8, you may have difficulty, but the staff is incredibly friendly and are happy to accommodate. I came here with my boyfriend and his family on a Saturday evening, there were 8 of us total include 3 very rowdy kids, adorable, but they're between the ages of 4-9 so very easily excited.  The staff didn't blink an eye, they were absolutely fantastic with us even when we had to change tables, they immediately accommodated us and the service was great. We shared appetizers, calamari- delicious, small portion, Bruscetta- very fresh tomatoes and the sauce was amazing along w the bread, and baked goat cheese, if you like goat cheese, it's amazing, it comes in a tomato sauce with toasted garlic bread, kind of bland, but not terrible. We split a large Cesar salad, the greens were very fresh, but the dressing was a bit bland, it was still good, just not great.  My BF ordered the seafood pasta in a red sauce, the seafood was very fresh and well season, the pasta was great. I ordered the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, The menu doesn't say that any veggies come with it, just the plain pasta, but when I asked if veggies could be added, the server said I could add whatever I wanted, it was a large group ordering, so as not to hold it up I only ordered mushrooms, but if I would have know that anything could go in the gnocchi, so it would be very helpful if that were listed on the menu or even offer a wider selection of gnocchi dishes. And I wasn't a huge fan of the Gorgonzola sauce, you can choose between about 10 other sauces, but it was a little overwhelming on the menu and I didn't know what would go best, so that's my fault for ordering it.  I was surprised by how small the portions seemed, the price point is pretty affordable, but I finished my plate and I was still hungry, and that never happens when I east pasta.  The food was good, but the service was outstanding and we will definately be back.
I can not remember anything else but the gnocchi with gorgonzola!! S p e c t a c u l a r!! I am looking forward to go again and order them!

This place wasn't great and it wasn't horrible.  I was super grateful that they had an open table at 5:45pm on a Saturday night and they had booster seats for my girls, which was a huge plus.  They brought our food quickly which is a huge plus when you are eating out with kids.  The garlic bread was bland and totally not worth wasting money on.  The Mac and cheese was decent. My pasta was supposed to have a cream sauce but it tasted like there was nothing on it.  The kids liked the open kitchen and getting to watch the food being cooked.  It was loud so when my kids got loud they weren't out of place.  They also really liked the painting on the walls.
The pasta is very fresh, light, and flavorful. The sauce to pasta ratio is great and the angel hair is actually angel hair. My favorite is the penne funghi
Favorite place in the world. Amazing five star pasta for such great prices. Nice people, very friendly and polite.

This place is amazing ! I came here with my partner on Valentine's Day. We got there and as soon as we walked in we were seated which was awesome for it being a holiday.  We sat up front on the counter by the cooks.  We started off with a caesar salad w/ shrimp. It was very good. The shrimp added an extra flavor to the salad. It's a must have.  She ended up getting the special of the day which was heart shaped raviolis ( cute!) and I order the jalapeño gnocchi .... Both dishes were great in taste and it was lots of food!  The sauces for both dishes were very good! We were really impressed by the food and prices! Who doesn't love a cheap dinner !? This is a place you should definitely visit sometime!

Love the food these guys serve! Me and my wife ordered Bruschetta, Linguini Pesto, Gnocchi with spicy vodka tomato sauce. We really felt like the food was very authentic. Gnocchi was so soft and the feeling was very tasty. Gnocchi melts as soon as you put it on your tongue. Linguini Pesto with generous amount of pesto sauce makes the perfect bite. Great service and really nice people.  The only criticism was that the Bruschetta was very sour because the balsamic that was mixed with tomatoes makes the whole combination way too sour. Balsamic glaze should be used to balance the sweet + sour profile but I think there was only balsamic vinegar used instead. That's my only negative comment. But again, compared to the other great food/drinks we received, this negative point is very very minor.  Thank you Pasta Palazzo for the great food. I think we found our favorite Italian restaurant!

About 15 years ago, I frequently dined at Pasta Palazzo, which has a wonderfully quaint and romantic ambience.  The food was incredible, especially the Cavatappi Pollo--my favorite dish.  What a surprise to find the quality of the food as outstanding as it was over a decade ago! The only downside, and it's just a factor of logistics, is the seating close to the bathrooms in the back.  The restaurant is small and if you have to sit at the tables in the rear, there may be an odor coming from the bathroom that is less than pleasing and can alter your dining experience, if you know what I mean.  So, if all the tables toward the front of the restaurant are taken, opt for the counter seating, which offers a chance to watch your food being prepared.  Highly recommend this restaurant.
I just love the portabella burger!!! Their garlic bread was very dry and hard. Appetize options are limited.

Best bang for you buck. Super convent, great staff. We started off with an order of bruschetta, which is fucken dank. Followed by ravioli with vodka sauce, the sauce is mildly spicy but still enjoyable. Second dish was an order of gnocchi with Alfredo sauce, absolutely zero flaws. Great little space filled with nothing but home made cooking and an homie atmosphere. Great spot for a quick catch-up with friends.

I love this low-key always delicious inexpensive pasta place.  I'm that gal who has to make changes and substitutes on all my orders and they don't care (or are good at pretending).  My go to is the mushroom penne but everyone loves the gnocchi!
Had the gnocchi with marinara sauce and sangria to drink. Very delicious and will definitely be going back.
Great homemade pastas!  The gnocchi is stuffed with ricotta and is delish.
I had amazing bolognese with gluten free noodles. I've gone back multiple times for the same order.
Great neighborhood spot with good pasta, fresh ingredients, cheap prices, and quick service.  The apps and salads are amazing too.

Huge fan, love the customization you can get and you end up with a reasonable portion for a reasonable price whereas a lot of Italian places dump like 1.5 meals worth of pasta on you and then charge double or triple. It's pasta, it shouldn't be that expensive. Pasta Palazzo puts a more casual twist on it with friendly servers and good prices. I got the jalapeno stuffed dumplings with roasted red pepper puree and added sundried tomatoes. It was incredible, I'd get it in a heartbeat. I didn't feel overly full at the end and I cleaned my plate - everything about the dish was great. There was some heat to it, but not too powerful. The gnocchi was good, but the sauce was the highlight. That roasted red pepper puree was superb. I'm definitely going back, it's a unique option when looking for a pasta dinner and it executes the concept perfectly.

What a great little place! Really good pasta and good prices. We couldn't wait two hours for a table at cafe babareeba and so we walked down the street and were pleasantly surprised. We got seated right away on a weekend night at 8:00. Only downside is that the tables are really cramped and the bathrooms are like right in the dining area. I'll definitely go back though! Yum.

Just so consistently great. The service is always impeccable and the food is freshly made. The sangria is always a favorite and the capellini pomodoro is the best! Be sure to get it. The fresh tomatoes are on point in this dish. It's a small, quaint place, but super welcoming. Great for lunch or a quick bite to eat. It's an open kitchen, so be ready to smell all the goodness!

I've been here twice and both times I had fantastic meals. Portions are nice and big and pasta is delicious! I do find that some of the cream based pastas are a little bit underseasoned so I usually add a bit of salt. Each time I have gone with one other person, we end up ordering 3 pastas just because we can't decide! My favourite is the mushroom penne and anything with the spicy tomato cream sauce. If you want pasta or comfort food, this is absolutely the best place to go.

This place is simple, casual and has great prices. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. The place is pretty tiny but it's nice that the cooks make the food in an outdoor space. The calamari is perfectly cooked and the bruschetta is really fresh with good flavor. The mushroom pasta is rich and SO amazing! If I don't get that I get the pesto pasta which is equally as good.

Food is really, good, fresh and tasty.    I think they have small portions however their prices are so reasonable that  I keep going back.   The smoked chicken ravioli is so delicious and I absolutely love the asparagus.

The brushcetta tastes very fresh and flavorful! The hint of balsamic really hit the spot. The sausage risotti special is also great!  The rice was a bit under cooked but the flavor of the sauce more than made up for it.  The service is very quick and efficient despite how small the restaurant is!  And it's super cool that you can sit at the counter and watch them cook!  I'm definitely coming back to this place!

This place was awesome. Gnocchi bolognese: wish we would have gotten a different combo. The gnocchi were so light and fluffy but the bolognese didn't pair well with it in terms of texture because the ground meat and light fluffy gnocchi were a weird combo. But in terms of flavor it was spot on. Penne fungi: Such a great sauce and amazing mushroom flavor. So good!!!  Cavatappi pollo: Soooo good!!!! This was the star of the show. Such reasonable prices too. We will definitely be back!

Can't beat their prices, good food, cute interior and friendly servers.   Love:  Gnocchi with pesto cream sauce Polenta Pumpkin Ravioli Meh: Vodka sauce. Too acidic for our taste. In their defense, it's normally spicy and we requested that they make it not spicy. It's probably better if you let them do it their way.  Free bread. It's probably rude to complain about free stuff but I don't like their bread. I prefer a crunchy crusted bread.

Walked in and had a great dinner with friends. I had the tortellini with bolognese sauce and loved it. Others in the table also loved their food. The place is small and can get somewhat loud which we didn't mind at all. Will go back when in town.

We went here for my daughters birthday dinner. We were a table of 8 and we all ordered different plates. Appetizers, salads, sandwiches and of course pasta. It was all very tasty everybody seemed to enjoy their meal. The waiter was awesome. He made sure we all had refills. He even brought our daughter a piece of cake with a candle. He was very attentive. It's a pretty tight place but we never felt pressured to leave. Then again the restaurant wasn't busy. It turned out to be a great dinner with family.

This place is the best Italian Food value in the city.  I have been coming here for six years and the food is always amazing and the service is fast and friendly.  Try the homemade Gnocchi with meat sause, amazing!
Go here all the time.  Food is solid and service it fast and very nice.  My only complaint is that you leave smelling of too much food.
Really loved this place! The bruschetta was so good! This is definitely going into our regular rotation!

I have been trying to make it to this place for weeks! The pictures of their food look amazing and I'm shocked it to me this long to make it to this place that is so near by.  I finally had the chance to come here for dinner with my bf and a group of friends before a concert at Joe's.  It was Friday about 6pm and we were seated immediately.  This place is actually very small and filled up super fast shortly after we got here, plus they don't take reservations.  What I love about this place is that you can see your food being made for you and it smells amazing and comes out pretty quickly.  We ordered a variety of items including their mac and cheese and artichoke ravioli in champagne sauce (both were daily specials), bruschetta, calamari, mariner tortellini and jalapeño gnocchi.  Everything was made to order, steaming hot, and you could tell it was fresh.  I really think all of their sauces were really flavorful and the gnocchi like little soft pillows.  Also, for such quality food, it is very reasonably priced.  The plates are not huge but just enough to fill you.
I imagine if I grew up in an Italian household home cooked meal would be like what you get here. The sauces that are made in front of you taste amazing! Must try the polenta appetizer here.

Pasta Palazzo has quickly become one of my go-to spots after moving to the Armitage / Lincoln Park area.  Affordable prices, quick service, and decent portions.  Only downside is that the food is pretty greasy, but that's not too surprising when eating out.
Very good food. The service is very good. The ladies are very nice and friendly.  Great casual place for great pasta.

I LOVE pasta. Typically, I peruse the menu of any place to find the pasta section and here, the entire menu is a pasta section!! The service is fast and friendly. It's a cute urban vibe. I recommend the pesto tortellini.

Pasta Palazzo is great! Every dish I've tried is always done to perfection and the pricing is very reasonable. The sangria is pretty tasty and can creep up on you with it's deceiving sweetness. Caution! :). No only is the food and sangria a great, but the staff adds the icing to the cake. All very welcoming and super sweet. This place is a keeper.

Jalapeño Gnocchi, please order it. The softest and most delicious I've ever had. I recommend adding a protein to it as well, but even if you don't it's amazing.  Smaller place with many shared tables which is nice when not crowded, but not ideal when it is. Also love that the kitchen is right in front of you. Great spot for casual date or cheap but delicious dinner.

My Favorite Italian Restaurant , I have been coming to eat/ order food here for the past 10 years, yea since I was pregnant and had the weirdest tastes for food. They will always made my baby and me happy even burning the cream I wanted that way so go ahead and keep it longer on the stove. Great food, great service, great owners, Pancho is a really nice Cheff .
This is my 2nd time here and the jalapeño gnocchi is by far my favorite! I have attempted to try other dishes but nothing beats the gnocchi! Great service and tastes great to go as well!

The food here really is excellent and it's in kind of a funky neighborhood. However, the service is nothing less than horrific. The servers were all busy texting. Almost all of the seating is on high chairs, very uncomfortable, and some of the table placements almost guarantee you will literally be elbow-to-elbow with other diners. I've been twice and both times the experience was ruined because of the "table neighbors." The first time it was some idiot yuppie couple with bratty obnoxious children. The second time it was with a gnarly sweaty couple who together topped out at about 600 pounds. The ambience is terrible. I don't know if the acoustics in the room are shit or what, but you practically have to yell to converse with your dining companion as well as the servers. Also, they make it pretty clear that they don't like solo diners. Never going back!

I come here every time I visit Chicago.  It's a must.  Small but cozy Lincoln Park restaurant that makes you feel you're in a real neighborhood place. You are feeling lucky when you get a window table for people watching.  Specials are posted on a blackboard plus the selections on the regular menu. Portions are good, prices are better and the food is terrific.  Always looking for grilled calamari and this place does it well! Service is sometimes slow, but never enough to make a fuss.

Ordered grilled calamari for 10$ it was discussing and raw sent it back waiter said nothing because this bearded no showered ass was more concerned with his cell phone and full plate of pasta he decided to eat at the bar three feet in front of us that he could care less about his job. He never washed his hands between attending to us and his meal and talking on his phone making plans for after work clearly because we could hear every word  it was gross we walked out no apology I will never visit
Casual, good service, nice portions, and good price for the location. Nice place to go for a good bite to eat when you don't feel like dressing up but is too lazy to cook at home.

Get the: Conchiglie in gongorzola sauce and  Jalapeno Gnocchi (with chorizo added) The pasta was perfect in every way. They added just enough sauce and other ingredients to make the overall flavor wonderful. The free bread at the beginning was "meh", but HEY, free bread! I would skip that and fill up on the pasta. They had a nice wine list, but I would have liked if they provided wine glasses. However, I can chug faster from a normal water glass anyway, so this worked in my favor.  Will definitely be back.

Very nice neighborhood restaurant. It is kinda small place but very nice. My first time there was a good experience. The food there was very delicious and the price was right. I expected the prices for the dinners to be higher but they were right on par with the portions given. We ordered two different meals and shared them and both were very good. Their staff was very friendly and accommodating. They were very detailed in describing the meals we had questions about and gave good recommendations. Overall, our food selection was top notch. My only complaint was that they only had two gentleman that were working the whole floor. They were taking orders, bussing tables, refilling drinks, bringing out food: they were doing it all. And because of that, it was a little slow getting our food ordered and drinks refilled but it was Friday night and they were slammed so I'm not going to hold that against them. The next time I go, I'll try during the week when its not so busy but I will be back again.
Honestly my favorite pasta spot in Chicago. The environment there is so great and the food is sooooooo good! You will not regret going here

This place never disappoints! It is very reasonably priced with generous portions. The caprese appetizer is delicious, especially when adding balsamic vinegar. My favorite is the pasta funghi with chicken added. A must stop for a great dinner!

I'm still having dreams about the food here. I've only been here twice, but I'm already planning my next trip.  I was here last Saturday and had the asparagus ravioli. It was a special so if you see it again, get it! And if you're a calamari person, the grilled calamari here is a must. I should also mention the jalapeno gnocchi that I've had in the past and it was amazing. I'm not usually down with spicy, but these were so delicious that I could not stop eating it.

Really nice neighborhood restaurant with great food.  We went into Chicago for a show and found this place for dinner with the family.   My only complaint is the price of the wine. Very tiny glass at a high price.  Stick to the soft drinks.
Had the healthy scallops, very happy with my meal. Also enjoyed the sangria!  Small but quaint.

What a welcoming place! I was visiting Chicago by myself and, just by looking in the window, I knew I would be comfortable. I sat at the bar and the staff made me feel so welcome. I had a simple but delicious meal of ravioli with marinara sauce, triple chocolate cake that was even more addictive than it sounds, and nice glass of California chardonnay. I wish I had found Pasta Palazzo before my last night in Lincoln Park!

Stopped by last Sunday around noon. No waiting! Very hungry and limited options in this neighborhood. Ate here once before over 15 years ago. Remember it was pretty good. Limited menu but everything very fresh and with open kitchen you can see it being made .  Had pasta with Gorgonzola and spinach. Very creamy and rich. Good flavor without being overwhelming .  Came with some bread. I typically don't go out of my way to eat pasta as I make it a lot at home but worth the stop. Prices are reasonable which you would hope for with pasta!
The stuffed gnocchi is phenomenal!! Reasonable prices too! Definitely worth checking out!

Are you sick of "Italian" restaurants charging an arm and a leg for inexpensive pasta dishes?  Well, Pasta Palazzo is here to save the day.  Great prices for delicious pastas!  Super nice staff, easy dining experience.  If I'm not making pasta at home, I'm letting them make it for me here.

Love, Love, Love Pasta Palazzo. Live in the neighborhood and really enjoy ordering take-out. Food is always ready in under 20 minutes and is still piping hot by the time I get it home to enjoy! Favorite dishes include the Meatball Sandwich and the Cavatappi Pollo - a must try for both. Oh and did I mention they have a great website, love the design and ease of use. Soo happy to have you as a neighbor!
Everything was amazing. The service was great and the food was even better. Can't wait to go back again soon.

I adore Pasta Palazzo. I've eaten in once and ordered takeout about three times. I must admit that I've only ever ordered one thing here - the gnocchi. I can't help it. I don't want to order anything else because I love these soft little pillowy pockets of deliciousness. The price is also great - $10. I'll be honest though, I always find myself wanting more more more! Maybe one day I'll finally find the courage to venture out and try something new on the menu but let's be realistic, I'm probably never going to stray from my beloved gnocchi.

Italian food can be expensive, especially for yummy Italian food! I was so impressed with their prices, their quality of food and great service! Russ, our waiter, was charismatic, helpful and an absolute delight!   Their Chicken Risotto was really great! Make sure to catch it on special. Their appetizers, Grilled Calamari and Bruschetta was just as yummy. My co-worker loved her dish as well! Make sure to try their Sangria too! I've worked in the neighborhood for a year now, and finally tried it. Got seated right away on a Friday late night. I can't wait to go back/order take out. Like I said, their prices are incredible for how great the food is.
Solid fresh made pasta in a small casual environment. I had the jalapeño gnocchi and tried some bruschetta. Very glad I checked this place out. Wish I had something similar in my neighborhood.

My girlfriend and I wanted to try someplace new so we gave it a try. We sat right up at the bar and it was fun to watch the cooks work plus it kept us warm from the opening and closing door. I tried the Shrimp ravioli with spicy tomato sauce. It wasn't very spicy but I didn't mind because I love shrimp. My girlfriend had the gnocci which was tasty as well. Very affordable. Fun atmosphere. We will be back.

This is an amazing Italian restaurant.  Please note: THIS PLACE IS NOT BYOB.  You can byob but there is a $10 corkage fee.  Regardless, great food, great atmosphere.  They have wine, Italian beer, etc. Don't buy a $10 bottle at 711 and double the price of the bottle from this mislead rumor.  But eat here everyday. Yum.
Dinner for 2 for $14.37... Sounds fake, right? It was delicious, the guys in the kitchen work like a well oiled machine.

My wife and I love going here for a really good and inexpensive dinner. I rotate between my two favorite meals, the Conchiglie Classico and Penne Con Salsiccie. Both are so good that I have a hard time venturing to other dishes on the menu.  I would suggest getting here earlier in the evening or doing carry out. It is somewhat small inside and gets very busy on the weekends. Waiting outside in the summer is fine, but there is not much room to wait inside when it is cold.

My friend and I had not planned on coming here but found that the places we wanted to go to had an hour wait and we were starving! We stumbled upon this cute little pasta place and decided to check it out. I personally am not a fan of pasta because I am gluten and lactose free so I had planned on just getting a salad.  The menu is short but to the point and they actually had these healthy pasta choices that are made without butter and cheese! OMG how wonderful is that! This excited me, now I just had to find out if they had gluten free pasta...they did! WOOHOO so I got one of the healthy pastas with gluten free noodles and it was DELICIOUS! There is an up-charge of $2 for the gluten free noodles but unfortunately I understand why, gluten free is more expensive :/ My friend and I also split a caprese salad and that was also very good and very easy to split. The service was also good! The waiter was very kind and understanding when I asked about the gluten free noodles.  They also split our check for us.  Because I am not a huge pasta fan in general I probably won't come back here too often, but my friend LOVES pasta and will be going back!

Great food & atmosphere!!  It's a little small on the inside and we had to wait for a table for a bit, but it was worth the wait.  Mushroom risotto with chicken and broccoli with a Marsala cream sauce (special) was amazing!  As were the baked goat cheese and calamari appetizers.  Yum yum yum!!

Get the Jalapeño Gnocchi. Both times I have come here, I've ordered or shared this dish and will continue to do so on my future visits. I also had the Ceasar Salad with freshly grilled shrimp on top, which was very tasty. The service it also great and quick.

A friend and I TRIED to eat all Pasta Palazzo, but left after we were ignored for five minutes after we walked in the door. Granted, it was a busy Friday night, but there was more than one table available. The servers were too busy sipping their sodas to even acknowledge us. Will we be going back? Doubtful.

Always looking for a pasta joint...and this just may be the perfect place! It's inexpensive and there are so many different options. Yummy yummy yummy! Will definitely be coming back here. The waiter was very nice as well!

An excellent place to grab a top-notch, well-priced Italian meal!  Service is great with a quick wit and great timing.  Open kitchen with extremely fresh food and a fabulous bolognese! Very reasonably priced - I would pay more for this quality of food!  Serving sizes are spot on, too!

I've been here a few times and it is fantastic. Went with the Seafood risotto with broccoli in a tomato cream sauce on the most recent visit, and it was by far the best pasta dish I've ever had. Service is always great.

I don't usually write reviews, but do for places that are well deserved.  I've frequented this place many times and each time the food, and service has been consistently great! I used to live right behind Pasta Palazzo and that was my definite go to spot for good affordable food.  Now that I moved, I still travel to go there.  The newer restaurants next to Pasta Palazzo have been on my list, but I still seem to walk thru Pasta Palazzo's doors instead! Pasta palazzo, I love you!  We always get the bruschetta, and mushroom(add gorgonzola) appetizer and the cavatappi pollo! so good!!

My husband and I live south but try to make it here whenever we're in the area. Be prepared to leave stuffed.  The fetucinni Alfredo is absolutely delicious!   Everything is made fresh when you order and I always try to sneak a peak at how the cooks prepare our meal.   I also always get the asparagus with the lemon butter sauce.  Hmmmm.  My husband has actually learned how to make that at home and it comes out perfectly.  The service is good and fast,  although we purposely come during the week for an early dinner because we know it can get crowded.

This is my second time coming to Pasta Palazzo. After the first time I kept bringing it up as a spot to go, finally I got my chance and it was worth the wait! They don't take reservations so we showed up at about 7. We were told we would have a 30 minute wait but ended only waiting about 10! Under promise and over deliver is always the way to go. We ordered appetizers of the goat cheese, garlic bread, and bruschetta along with sangria which were all amazing. Onto the main course. I had the Cavatappi Pollo & it was great, I finished every last bite! Perfect portion for the price and tasted fresh and delicious. I'm assuming this is the same for everything on the menu! My only wish for pasta palazzo is that they expand to a bigger space and have a few more waiters on during the busy time. We had a hard time flagging someone down when we needed them since the only 2 people working were so busy!  Can't wait to go back for whenever I have that pasta craving.

A very delicious place to grab a plate of pasta. Super convenient and doesn't take too long. Not too many tables, so expect a wait when you go during peak hours. Also, I went with my cousin who has a severe fish allergy, they NEVER cross contaminate. It's always nice when a restaurant accommodates their customers like that. Hand-crafted pasta with sausage is the best!

My husband and I love this place.  We have been coming here since we were in college.  We love the fact that it is GOOD FOOD that isn't over priced, its pasta for God's sake! They always have daily specials, great portions, good atmosphere. Prices are great, and I always have leftovers. I have introduced this place to so many family and friends, and have never had a complaint!  They don't take reservations, so if you come on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll probably have to wait a little while for a table, but trust me it will be worth it!  Love Pasta Palazzo!

I haven't been here for a few years, so I thought I'd give it another try. Scott, my waiter, explained in detail how the Pumpkin Ravioli were made, so I had an order. Awesome in their buttery sauce,  sage and a little Parmesan, pan fried. Then I had the Tomato Dill soup. Great! The cook, Poncho, explained to me that he's been here 17 years and watched nearby restaurants come and go. This one is still here with the same quality. Scott will explain any food you might want  in detail. Reasonable prices. I'll be back.

Chicago is such a wonderful city. No matter what neighborhood you are wandering in, you will find something great to eat in the most unexpected of places.  We went here on a Sunday for lunch. Its a pretty small hole in the wall place. But still has an elegant and warm ambiance. The service is awesome and very friendly. We ordered the asparagus soup which was one of their specials for the day. We also ordered the jalapeno gnocchi - which was a revelation. It came in a red pepper sauce. The gnocchi looked very vibrant and packed a flavor punch. One of the most unique gnocchi dishes I have eaten. The home made gnocchi, is soft, fluffy and doughy and had a great kick from the jalapeno. Hubby and me loved it. The soup was very flavorful and had real asparagus pieces in it.  It is a gem of a place... i definitely want to go back to try some of their other pasta dishes.

Pasta Palzazzo is the only place in Chicago in the Lincoln Park neighborhood for pasta! A friend and I stumbled upon Pasta Palazzo a few years ago and its a must for any visit to Chicago. Check out their daily specials, all of their pasta and sauces are amazing. Their vegetariano salad is one of the best salads I've ever enjoyed, great mix of perfectly grilled zucchini, peppers, eggplant on mixed greens  On this visit smoked chicken ravioli with gorgonzola was one of the specials, my friend and I devoured it and would have loved more!  If you like pasta, friendly service in a great neighborhood, look no further than Pasta Palazzo!

My new love! The husband and I heard about this place from a friend and decided to try it last night. We were really impressed and cannot wait for our next visit. Here's all you need to know: 1. Delicious food - We had the conchiglie gorgonzola and jalapeno gnocchi 2. Awesome price point - Entrees are only $8-$10 3. Great service and friendly staff It's the perfect no frills restaurant. I would love to try their entire menu!
What a little gem... Great place. Simple and genuine Italian specialties. The gnocchi are great. Try the jalapeño option. The goat cheese appetizer is also great.

Love this place! What to say, great food, really friendly service, and all at exceptional prices.  The always fresh grilled calamari is light with a nice lemon citrus sauce.  Don't forget to try the jalapeño gnocci the sauce is incredible (for those who love sausage add it to the sauce for added flavor, not that it needs it at all). Try it I've never brought friends or family that didnt enjoy it.
Cavatappi pollo! Best thing on the menu. The sangria is great as well. The service here is always wonderful too. Small quaint place with nice service and great food.

This is my go-to pasta place in the city for the past 5-6 years.  Their pasta dishes are simple but delicious.  I like that you can do whole wheat pasta if you choose and extras to your pasta.  The staff is always friendly as willing to offer suggestions.  They dishes are always very well priced.   I am also very happy that they now accept credit cards.   Also,all the food is made right  in front of you!

I came here for dinner with 2 friends on a Saturday night because of their recommendation that it was cheap, good eats and Pasta Palazzo did not disappoint! All the pastas were $10 or under, which is a crazy price for handmade or seafood pasta. Everything looked good on the menu, but I decided on something I knew I couldn't make at home and went with the gnocchi, which was filled with ricotta and topped with bolognese. The dish was sooo good and comforting and each little gnocchi was a soft little pillow that just melted in my mouth. My friends got the spaghetti frutti di mare and conchiglie gorgonzola, which was also really tasty. They portions are very generous for $10 and they even had leftovers to spare (sadly I completely cleaned my plate). Will definitely be back to try other dishes!!

Perfect simple Italian food while shopping the Armitage/Halsted corridor.  Good variety of options on the menu and prices are reasonable.  I've visited twice in the last month and both times and enjoyed a delicious lunch.  I plan to start ordering take out in the evenings as well.  The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the last time I was seated at the bar overlooking the kitchen area and I watched a chef dig his hands (no gloves) into a bowl of fresh basil and sprinkle it over my food.  Was a little unappetizing.  He should be wearing gloves or use a spoon and not handling food with his bare hands.  Wouldn't stop me from going back, but I hope they take notice and up their hygiene standards a bit.
Another Lincoln Park restaurant that's never let me down. Every dish I've had was delicious, the daily specials are always interesting, and the sangria is a perfect companion to all their meals.

All my friends call me a food snob and that that goes double for Italian food. This place is amazing!! The staff is wonderful, they really make you feel at home. The food. I got Spaghetti Frutti di Mare and everything was spot on. I have never had such perfectly cooked sea food with pasta. I don't normally like red sauce but I scraped my plate clean to get all of it because it was one of the best sauces I've ever had. This is definitely a place to check out and become a regular!

My fiance, daughter and I were strolling around Lincoln Park on a Monday, doing some school clothes shopping and enjoying a beautiful summer day when we all decided it was time to eat.  Not being from the area, we didn't have any real knowledge of the nearby dining options, so we just looked for something that looked appetizing.  We saw Pasta Palazzo, checked the menu in the window and needed about three seconds to decide to give it a try.
